description.narrative:
International development aid will not be enough to reach the Sustainable Development Goals of the 2030 agenda. To reach the goals, low- and middle-income countries will need to increase their domestic resource mobilisation. An import step in this direction is to increase the efficiency of the tax revenue collection. An efficient, transparent and fair tax administration is key in the process towards eradicating poverty and building well-functioning sustainable societies.
The project is a peer-to-peer collaboration between the Swedish Tax Agency (STA) and the Moldova State Tax Service (STS). The project is expected to contribute to a fairer and more equal system for taxation, where all citizens, regardless of status, ethnicity or income are treated fairly. A special focus of the project is to continue supporting STS’ reform process from ‘tax police’ to public service provider.
The project objective is Increased Tax revenue, Increased efficiency of STS, Enhanced equity, fairness, integrity and professionalism in treatment of tax payers, well trained and knowledgeable staff. The project has three components: 1. Human Resources Management - Strengthened human resources improving effectiveness and efficiency; 2. International Exchange of Information - Compliance with international standards; and 3. Tax Enforcement - The tax arrears management is streamlined and improved.
The project is a continuation of a previous successful peer-to-peer collaboration between STA and STS (2013 – 2016).

Internationellt bistånd på egen hand, kommer inte att vara tillräckligt för att uppnå hållbarhetsmålen i 2030 agendan. För att nå målen krävs att låg- och medelinkomstländer ökar sin interna resursmobilisering. Ett viktigt steg i denna process är att öka effektiviteten i skattesystem. En effektiv, transparent och rättvis skatteadministration är en viktig del mot att minska fattigdom och bygga väl fungerade uthålliga samhällen.
Projektet är ett tekniskt samarbete mellan Svenska Skatteverket (STA) och den Moldaviska Skattemyndigheten (STS). Projektet förväntas bidra till ett mer rättvist system för skatteindrivning, där alla medborgare, oavsett ekonomisk status, inkomster eller etnisk tillhörighet behandlas lika. Projektet är ett led i STS reformprocess från ”skattepolis” till en serviceinriktad organisation gentemo skattebetalarna.
Projektets mål är att öka skatteintäkter, öka effektiviteten hos STS, en mer professionell, rättvis och jämlik behandling av skattebetalarna och välutbildade tjänstemän. Projektet har tre komponenter: 1. Personalhantering och förändringsarbete; 2. Internationellt utbyte av skatteinformation; 3. Skatteindrivning.
Projektet är en fortsättning av ett tidigare mycket lyckat tekniskt samarbete mellan STA och STS (2013 – 2016).

The project will contribute to the on-going modernisation and capacity building of the Moldova State Tax Service (STS), to support STS’ reform efforts towards a public service - voluntary compliance oriented approach to tax administration. The project objective is Increased Tax revenue, Increased efficiency of STS , Enhanced equity, fairness, integrity and professionalism in treatment of tax payers, well trained and knowledgeable staff. The project has three components: 1. Human Resources Management: Strengthened human resources improving effectiveness and efficiency. 2. International Exchange of Information: STS to compliance with international standards. 3. Tax Enforcement: The tax arrears management is streamlined and improved. The desired impacts on development and operations on an overall level of the Project are: Increased tax revenue; Increased efficiency of STS; Enhanced equity, fairness, integrity and professionalism in treatment of taxpayers; Well-trained and knowledgeable staff. The project will contribute to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of Agenda 2030: ‘Goal 1 No poverty’ (expected positive effect on poverty reduction from increased tax revenue on public spending on health, education and infrastructure); ‘Goal 8 Sustainable economic growth’ (through increased efficiency and predictability of tax revenue collection); ‘Goal 10 Reduced inequalities’ (will benefit from a more predictable application of tax rules through enhanced equity, fairness, integrity and professionalism in STS treatment of taxpayers); ‘Goal 16 Strong institutions’ (Strengthened institutional capacity of STS); and ‘Goal 17 -Target 17-1 Mobilize resources to improve domestic revenue collection’.

description.narrative: 2020 was very much affected by COVID-19 pandemic. However almost all agreed activities were implemented, and the following results were produced: - Agreement between project partners to continue the cooperation through the digital interactions and communication via Zoom. - A finalised version (classroom version) of the STS leadership-training program including purpose, objective, agendas, detailed content, support for trainers and study material. - Draft primary legislation concerning the CRS-implementation submitted to the Ministry of Finance. Consultations with the National commission for financial markets, the National Anticorruption Center and the National Bank concerning the draft primary legislation as well as considerations due to the comments received. - The drafting of the secondary legislation underway, involving discussion, choices and decisions on optional provisions and regulations for effective implementation. Preparations for initiating communication activities with Financial Institutions. - Draft amendment of article 248 in the Insolvency act concluded (subsidiary liability). - Final draft amendment of article 203 in the Tax Code concluded including an explanatory note Approved application forms for outbound requests for recovery and information in accordance with the OECD Convention on Mutual Administrative Assistance in Tax Matters. - Decision to elaborate a methodology regarding tracking, categorisation and prioritisation of debtors. Decision to promote the information covered by the school information campaign through the STS website Decision to procure the services from a production company in order to produce three videos for the in the context of preventive communication. In 2020 the Embassy and STA decided to evaluate the project from gender point of view, to see where is possible to integrate gender perspective. For this, the Embassy involved Sida's gender focal point who did an evaluation of the project and proposed 2 short interventions both aiming at engaging the management in the dialogue on gender equality in tax matters.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
